catalog_info.title: Comic Literature through the Middle Ages: Seminar
catalog_info.description: An introduction to various kinds of literature broadly construed as comic, including drama, fabliaux, Latin lyrics, Chaucer, Middle Scots poetry and other genres up to Rabelais and Shakespeare. Non-English works read in a facing-page translation. With the help of Huizinga, Bakhtin, and later critics, students develop an understanding of what constitutes humor from this period, as well as the serious ``institutions'' that invite a comic reflex.
